page.title: 06Village trade-Blacksmith
page.content: When he first begain in business he shoed horses mainly, especially during the war when all metal was used in war projects. As farmers could afford tractors there was less work for him and his job in the lat 1950's was to repair the broken farm gear. When we joined the Common Market funds were available to replace the old machinery with more modern equipment. At this time he had to find other ways he could make use of his skill again. Nowadays he welds, makes wrought iron gates and fireplaces. He sometimes makes parts for things that are no longer available. He works behind the Co-op Shop. The Shop and his space is wanted for redevelopment. Many villagers signed a decision has been deferred for a time.
